title: Various record covers

 [‹ "Swiss Made" wide sans caps](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/typophile.com/node/38986 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Simple sans caps on Korres packaging - FF DIN {Simon H} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/typophile.com/node/39000 "Go to next forum topic")
author: merelschenk

comments.content: Fraktur typeface on the top is [Fette Fraktur](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/fette_fraktur/?sample_text=War%20Dance%20Funkmeister&sample_size=36&acs_ss=-1&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1).
‘The wages of sin’ on the second one is [University Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/university_roman/).
The Glory Mix in the first one is [ITC Honda](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/honda/).

(3)  
‘DON’T FORGET TO REMEMBER THE LORD’ is similar to [Typewriter](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/typewriter/) and [LTC Remington Typewriter](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-remington-typewriter/).

‘the bee gees’ is [Clarendon](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/clarendon_bold/?sample_text=the%20bee%20gees&sample_size=60&acs_ss=-1&acs_p=1&acs_pt=24&acs=1)?
Santa Esmeralda in the second is [Bradley](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/bradley-urw/).

**Nr. 8:** _Bash! Billy Bremner_ - I think this one is pre-digital, but you’ll get somewhat close with [Ategiziano](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/ategiziano/), [FTN Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/ftn_farao_reg.asp) or maybe [Antique Six](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/antique-six/)...
Nikki Lauren’s is Letter Gothic with an ITC Zapf Chancery ampersand

Wow, what a Type ID battlefield … just joining in a lil’ bit too late … ;°)  
All I can add is that “and slow” (Nº7) is a weird mixture of [Bauhaus](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/paratype/itc_bauhaus_ot/?sample_text=and%20slow&sample_size=36) and  
 [Horatio](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/elsner_flake/horatio/?sample_text=and%20slow&sample_size=36).
Tha last one (SHAKTIE ...) looks like a condensed version of [ITC Bookman](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-bookman/).

\> Wow, what a Type ID battlefield …

Yeah, and Akira beat us all – like so often.

BTW, “nice and slow” is the worst use of type I’ve seen in a looooong time.

Some classy stuff there! especially the first 2.

Nick Cooke

<cite>and Akira beat us all </cite>  
Yeah, he’s the power mower on this type lawn!

<cite>“nice and slow” is the worst use of type I’ve seen in a looooong time.</cite>  
Well, but it’s quite illustrative, isn’t it? ;°p  
“nice” is something like [Cabernet Swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000060).

As this hasn’t been adressed, some suggestions for “JESSE GREEN”:  
 [Bodoni Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/urw/bodoni_black_ot_std/?sample_text=JESSE%20GREEN&sample_size=48) is a good base, if you want to fill in the fruit yourself.  
 [Archive Garfield](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/archivetype/archive-garfield/) has similar proportions.  
Last but not least, [Lettres ombrées ornées](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/l/lettres.htm) and [Romantiques](http://web.archive.org/web/20071113005817/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/r/romantiques.htm) both are nice decorate slab freebies digitized by Dieter Steffmann.
